item.title: Umamusume Codes (August 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Umamusume Codes
  • How to Redeem Umamusume Codes
  • How to Get More Umamusume Codes

Umamusume is a training simulator where you have to help horse girls win races. Each of the Uma Musume has a different character and, more importantly, stats. So, you will need to train them differently to make them better at racing. To speed up your progress, you will want to use Umamusume codes.

Each such code contains various rewards, including currencies and other valuable items. With their help, you will be able to train your charges more effectively. However, due to the short duration of the activity, you will want to use them as soon as possible.

Updated August 1, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Unfortunately, there are no active Umamusume codes at the moment, but we are constantly monitoring the developers' social networks, and as soon as a new freebie appears, you will be the first to know about it. With that in mind, be sure to bookmark this article in your browser so you don't lose this source of rewards.

Umamusume Codes

Are There Any Working Umamusume Codes?

There are no active codes in Umamusume . We will update this article as soon as codes become available.

Expired Umamusume Codes

There are no expired codes in Umamusume .

At first glance, Umamusume has a rather complex gameplay and many modes and features. But in fact, everything is quite simple since you have to train your characters. It is worth noting that at first, not all possible horse girls are available to you. So, we recommend that you first try to earn currencies and summon new characters. After that, you can start climbing the ranks and progress.

To summon units, you need Carats, which are usually awarded for completing events or achievements. But there is an easier way to earn them, namely, using Umamusume codes.

Codes are a great source of free goodies in this incredible game. Even a couple of them will be enough for several pulls. However, due to the short term of activity, players can easily miss rewards. To avoid this, use Umamusume codes as soon as they are released.

How to Redeem Umamusume Codes

  • First, launch Umamusume .
  • Then, follow the short tutorial if you haven't done so already.
  • When you are given free will, open the menu by clicking on the corresponding button in the upper right corner.
  • Next, select the Enter Code option.
  • Finally, enter the code in the field and then click Ok.

If you do everything correctly and the codes are still active, you will receive a notification about receiving free goodies.

How to Get More Umamusume Codes

If you want to receive fresh Umamusume codes first-hand, you should start following the official social media pages of the developers. There you will find all the news about upcoming events, updates, and, of course, codes for this free mobile game.

  • Official Umamusume: Pretty Derby X page
  • Official Umamusume: Pretty Derby Discord server
  • Official Umamusume: Pretty Derby Facebook page

Umamusume is available on PC and mobile devices.

item.title: Half-Life 3 Insider Gives Promising Development Update
item.description:
A Half-Life 3 insider has shared more information that's come to light surrounding the game, and it bodes well for its release. The news is likely to excite fans who have been waiting for Half-Life 3 ever since Half-Life 2 Episode 2 closed out on a cliffhanger back in 2007.

Half-Life: Alyx delighted a lot of fans of the franchise back in 2020, but some caveats have kept it from being the game fans wanted most. Half-Life: Alyx is a prequel, so it doesn't help to wrap up the story of Gordon Freeman or resolve the cliffhanger that the game was left on in Episode 2. Further, outside of using unofficial mods, Half-Life: Alyx is only playable in VR, leaving a considerable subset of the gaming population out in the cold.

New information has now come to light from Gabe Follower regarding the development of the next Half-Life game, which has been codenamed HLX. The game still hasn't been announced by Valve, but its other modern games, Counter-Strike 2 and Deadlock , have just received updates that seem to include code referencing Half-Life 3 . The most exciting element of the discovery is that dataminers have discovered a great deal of code refactoring, which is essentially cleaning up the code. This is usually done in the late stages of a project, typically to improve efficiency prior to an official release, which could mean that Half-Life 3 (or X) will release sooner than players might expect.

What the Half-Life Code Leak Indicates

While these details don't provide any solid information about the game's story, they do give players an idea of how the technology powering the Half-Life games has evolved, and how that could impact gameplay. Gabe Follower has shared that some significant discoveries have been made that will impact physics, weather conditions, NPC AI, and vehicles. Dynamic wind systems, as well as improvements and optimization to NPC and object physics were part of the finds. Interestingly, the code also references Thumpers and Antlions, which are notably only found in the Half-Life franchise, further cementing that this code is likely connected to Half-Life , despite being found in other Valve games.

While these new details are certainly exciting, fans shouldn't hold their breath for the game's release. Valve is notorious for doing things at its own pace, and while it's certainly surprised the community by abruptly making big reveals in the past, there's no guarantee that will be the case here. After all these years of fans waiting for Half-Life 3 to be a reality, if it is indeed approaching its release, Valve is likely to take the time to ensure the game is as stable and bug-free as possible so as to not let down its long-time fans.

item.title: An Xbox Exclusive Game is Getting Delisted on September 30
item.description:
Taiko no Tatsujin: The Drum Master , a 2022 Xbox-exclusive rhythm game from Bandai Namco Entertainment, is being delisted on September 30. This means those interested in picking up Taiko no Tatsujin: The Drum Master have less than two months to purchase the game on the Xbox Store.

The Taiko no Tatsujin series of rhythm-based games has been around since the early 2000s, with titles having been released on various platforms over the years. However, The Drum Master stood out as the first Xbox-exclusive installment. The game was released on January 27, 2022, and was available on Xbox Game Pass. As the name suggests, Taiko no Tatsujin: The Drum Master involves playing the taiko drum, tasking players with keeping the rhythm in over 70 songs. While many series fans have praised the gameplay, the game ended up being removed from Xbox Game Pass in 2023. Now, it appears that rhythm game fans are running out of time to purchase a copy.

According to a notice on the seriesâ€™ official website, Taiko no Tatsujin: The Drum Master will be delisted from the Xbox Store on Tuesday, September 30, 2025, at 11:59 PM. The Xbox exclusivity of the title makes this news even more disappointing for fans, as there will seemingly be no other purchasing options. Taiko no Tatsujin: The Drum Master never had a physical release, making it impossible to find a copy of the popular rhythm game elsewhere.

Taiko no Tatsujin: The Drum Master is Being Delisted on September 30

Unfortunately, Bandai Namco Entertainment did not reveal the reason for the delisting in the statement on the series' website. Ahead of its removal, Taiko no Tatsujin: The Drum Master can be purchased on the Xbox Store for $49.99. It is worth noting that DLC packs will still be available for purchase after the game has been delisted. In addition, those who already own the game will still have access to the title after September 30 and can re-download the software if necessary.

While Taiko no Tatsujin: The Drum Master is being delisted, the developer has released another game in the series since then. Specifically, Taiko no Tatsujin: Rhythm Festival is available for Xbox platforms, along with Nintendo Switch and Steam. The game offers more rhythm-based gameplay for fans of the series to check out.

Despite this disappointing news regarding Taiko no Tatsujin: The Drum Master , Xbox fans have other games to check out in the coming weeks. For example, Xbox Game Pass recently added Farming Simulator 25 to its catalog, and Gears of War: Reloaded is coming on August 26.

76 songs including Gurenge, Feel Special, and Into the Night are available in the game! As well as Improvement Support that helps you with upping your drumming skills!

There are other modes to enjoy with everyone, like DON-chan Band, where Players work as a group of 4 to perform successful concerts! Also Great Drum Toy War, where Players make a deck of toys for Taiko battles!

Have fun playing Taiko solo, or together with friends!

item.title: Most Must-Play Open-World Games
item.description: Personal taste in video games varies wildly, so it can be hard to label any one game as a must-play. But within a certain genre, like, open world, itâ€™s a lot easier to name certain games that are must-plays. So today on GameRant, weâ€™re going over the most Must Play Open World Games.

item.title: Battlefield 6 is Just a Few Steps Away From Reaching Immersion Nirvana
item.description:
Following an explosive multiplayer reveal, it appears Battlefield 6 could be the most immersive experience in the franchiseâ€™s long history. The next installment in DICEâ€™s flagship series looks to build on the chaos the series is known for with more destructibility than ever before. Combined with the realistic improvements to player mobility and the suite of environment-altering equipment, the foundation of Battlefield 6 already seems solid.

Itâ€™s clear that Battlefield 6 aims to set new standards for immersion in the genre. In gameplay footage, explosions ripple through buildings and kick dust high into the air, and jet engines scream past with just the right amount of shock value. In the best moments of footage from the reveal, the game looks set to surpass the immersion of Battlefield 3 and 4 , but a few key elements keep the game from clearing that high bar.

A Few Small Fixes Could Cement Battlefield 6's Legacy

Despite its strong showing, Battlefield 6 isnâ€™t quite at the finish line in terms of immersion. Certain design decisions, likely made in the name of faster gameplay pacing, come at the cost of realism, player immersion, and sometimes, physics. One of the most jarring offenders is the grenade-throwing animation. The motion for the throwables resembles a sped-up version of the throwing knife animation from Battlefield 2042 , and in the bits of gameplay revealed so far, grenades are tossed with such speed that the animation is actually hard to see, stripping away the sense of realism or physicality from the mechanic.

The new grenade animation is definitely not very immersive, but it also turns what should be a measured gameplay decision into something that, given the speed of the action, is probably worth doing whenever possible.

Another immersion-breaking detail lies in the parachuting mechanics. During Battlefield 6 â€™s multiplayer reveal livestream, players were leaping from burning helicopters and deploying parachutes that rocketed through the air with unrealistic agility.

With Battlefield 6' s gameplay balance in mind, the decision to make parachutes faster makes the job of targeting airborne players significantly harder and eliminates any counterplay, but from an immersion standpoint, it veers into the uncanny. Parachuting in those situations should feel like a method of escape, not like an equally fast mode of travel.

Battlefield 6â€™s Sound Design Nails (Almost) Everything

The sound design on display in gameplay so far is near perfect. It all sounds remarkably gratifying, from little things like the sound of capturing a point in Conquest, to collapsing buildings echoing across city streets. Unfortunately, arguably the most important sounds, those of the weapons, donâ€™t meet the mark. Many of Battlefield 6 â€™s weapons sound muted, almost as if they were suppressed by default, and hitmarker sounds frequently blend into some of the weaponsâ€™ gunfire sounds, highlighting their lack of impact.

The reduced muzzle flash and seemingly mild recoil are welcome changes, but those elements, combined with the current weapon sounds, run the risk of making the weapons feel underpowered regardless of their actual efficacy. Naturally, itâ€™s a fine line to walk, as too much auditory chaos and the combat becomes overwhelming. If it stays too subtle, though, the weapons will feel like airsoft guns. Striking a decent balance is crucial, considering immersion is central to what Battlefield 6 is trying to achieve.

Plenty of Time Remains Ahead of Battlefield 6â€™s October Launch

With the open beta starting on August 7 and full release set for October 11, DICE still has time to address these relatively minor issues ahead of launch. The core gameplay of Battlefield 6 already shows a ton of promise. Environmental destructibility on a massive scale, improvements to player movement, and sheer audiovisual spectacle all mix into something that looks and sounds better than ever.

Still, a few tweaks are needed to ensure that the overall package is as immersive as possible. If those changes are made, Battlefield 6 would easily be the most immersive entry in the series, and maybe even the spiritual successor to Battlefield 3 and Battlefield 4 that fans have been waiting for.
